statement:
Let $X$ be a set and $\mathcal{F}$ be a filter on $X$. Then there exists
an ultrafilter $\mathcal{U}$ on $X$ which is finer than $\mathcal{F}$.

An importance consequnce of this theorem is the existence of free
ultrafilters on infinite sets. According to the theorem, there must
exist an ultrafilter which is finer than the cofinite filter. Since the
cofinite filter is free, every filter finer than it must also be free,
and hence there exists a free ultafilter.

Also note that this theorem requires the axiom of choice.
names: every filter is contained in an ultrafilter
